article.headline: Appalachian St. 79, Longwood 65
article.story: BOONE, N.C. (AP) -- D.J. Thompson scored 15 points to lead Appalachian State in a 79-65 win against Longwood on Wednesday night. Four other players for Appalachian State (15-9) also scored in double figures, with Noah Brown adding 14 and Herbert Jones chipping in 11. Clint Deas added 10 points and nine rebounds. Michael Jefferson scored 22 points for Longwood (1-27), while Maurice Sumter and Husein Pistoljevic each added 14. Longwood trailed just 36-31 at halftime despite shooting 40 percent from the field. They connected on 8 of 17 3-point attempts in the second half, but managed to make just 4 of 16 shots inside the arc. They also couldn't keep up at the free-throw line, where the Mountaineers were 20-for-31 to just 3-for-5 for Longwood.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
